alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Bamberg; Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Edgefield; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Saluda; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 9:22PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, Edgefield, Bamberg, Lexington, northern Aiken, Saluda, Orangeburg and southeastern Richland Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 921 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clarks Hill Recreation Area to 14 miles west of Edisto Gardens to near Sycamore. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Aiken, Lexington, West Columbia, Orangeburg, Cayce, Forest Acres, Batesburg-Leesville, Bamberg, Denmark, Oak Grove, Brookdale, McEntire Air Base, Red Bank, St. Andrews, Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, South Congaree and Pine Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 7 and 62. Interstate 26 between mile markers 109 and 165. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Bamberg; Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Edgefield; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Saluda; Southeastern Orangeburg
